column4: UPDATE 3-U.S. regulator seeks $29 mln from BP over natgas trading
column5: By Scott DiSavino     Aug 5 U.S. federal energy regulators on Monday ordered BP Plc to respond to allegations of natural gas market manipulation in Texas  threatening the energy company with fines near $29 million.     The move likely sets up another major legal battle for the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) as it steps up policing of power and natural gas markets.     In the order  FERC pointed to a two-minute recorded conversation between a BP trainee and a senior gas t

column4: Sony board votes to keep entertainment unit  rejects Loeb proposal
column5: Sony Corp's board voted unanimously not to sell its entertainment unit  rejecting a proposal from hedge fund manager Daniel Loeb  the company said in a statement on Monday.

column4: Statoil shuts Visund platform after power failure
column5: OSLO  Aug 5 Norwegian oil and gas firm Statoil  shut its Visund platform in the Norwegian North Sea late on Sunday because of a power failure  Stavanger Aftenblad said.

column4: Telecom Italia CDS under pressure again as Vodafone sues
column5: LONDON  Aug 5 (IFR) - The cost of insuring Telecom Italia's debt against default rose on Monday  while spreads on its cash bonds widened on news that British telecoms firm Vodafone is suing the company for EUR1bn     accusing it of abusing its dominant position in Italy.

column4: Nikkei slips as stronger yen hits exporters; Toyota down after earnings
column5: * Nikkei drops 1.3 pct  Topix down 1.1 pct     * Firmer yen triggers profit-taking in exporters  financials     * Toyota earnings fail to set market tone      By Tomo Uetake     TOKYO  Aug 5 Japan's Nikkei share average fell on Monday morning as the yen's strength against the dollar prompted investors to lock-in profits after recent strong gains  with exporters particularly hard hit.     The benchmark Nikkei  which rose 5.8 percent over the past two sessions  dropped 1.3 percent to 1

column4: Australia new vehicle sales up 4.1 percent in July: industry
column5: SYDNEY Sales of new vehicles in Australia were up 4.1 percent in July  compared to the same month last year  though down from a record peak in June when demand is typically boosted by end of financial year discounts.

column4: Vornado Realty second-quarter profit rises
column5: NEW YORK Vornado Realty Trust  on Monday said profit rose for the second quarter  as the value of its investment increased in J.C. Penney Company  Inc  department stores  offsetting a wider loss from its stake in toy store chain Toys R Us.

column4: Wells Fargo to offer credit cards that help cut consumer debt
column5: Wells Fargo & Co  the fourth-largest U.S. bank  is trying to grow its relatively small credit-card business with an unusual strategy: appealing to its customers' distaste for debt.
